page.title: 19RIVER AND COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: Dyce is surrounded to the north by countryside and to the south by the City of Aberdeen. The land is used intensively for agriculture and the main products of it are crops such as {barley, oil seed {rape and dairy produce}. There are also a number of{pig rearing units}in the area. The {River Don}flows through the area and forms the eastern and northern boundaries to the town itself. It is a large river and flows past the town in a large meander loop. Dyce is now truly a suburb of Aberdeen and{pressure on the {countryside for building space is ever {increasing.}Until only a few years ago the site of our school was good agricultural land.
